entry.title: ðŸ” Blog â€“ Single Sign-On (SSO): One Login to Rule Them All
entry.summary:
Welcome back, tech friends! ðŸ‘‹ Today, letâ€™s dive into Single Sign-On (SSO) â€” an authentication method that lets users log in once and access multiple applications without re-entering credentials. ðŸ” What is SSO? ðŸ’¡ Benefits: Minimizes password-related risks (re-use, phishing) Simplifies identity management Centralizes auditing and access control ðŸ’¼ SSO on Windows Server (Active Directory + ADFS) ðŸ› ï¸ Setup Overview: Configure Relying Party Trusts (i.e., your apps) Enable Claims-based authentication Use Kerberos for internal app SSO ðŸ’¡ Pro Tips: Integrate apps like SharePoint, Exchange, or third-party apps with ADFS. ðŸ§ SSO on Linux (SAML/OIDC for Web Apps) ðŸ› ï¸ Options: System Login: Use Kerberos with PAM or LDAP + SSSD Tools like Apache mod_auth_mellon for SAML on Apache servers ðŸ’¡ Example: Register app in Azure AD Configure SAML or OIDC endpoints Use libraries like oauthlib, python-social-auth, or passport.js for implementation â˜ï¸ SSO with Azure AD ðŸ› ï¸ Setup Highlights: Choose authentication method: SAML, OIDC, or Password-based SSO Assign users or groups to the app Use Conditional Access to enforce MFA or location-based policies ðŸ§© Pre-integrated Apps: Salesforce ServiceNow GitHub AWS Console ðŸ’¡ Quick Automation: powershell Get-AzureADServicePrincipal âš ï¸ Common Developer/IT Problems Solved by SSO
ðŸ” Bonus: When Not to Use SSO Critical systems requiring isolation (e.g., air-gapped networks) Apps that donâ€™t support modern auth protocols In such cases, consider MFA-only access or jump-hosting as alternatives. ðŸ§ Conclusion Next up: Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) â€” Your Second Layer of Defense!

entry.title: The power of Agentic AI: How Autonomous Agents are transforming Cybersecurity and Application Security
entry.summary: Introduction Artificial Intelligence (AI) as part of the constantly evolving landscape of cyber security, is being used by corporations to increase their defenses. As the threats get more complex, they are turning increasingly to AI. AI has for years been part of cybersecurity, is being reinvented into an agentic AI, which offers proactive, adaptive and contextually aware security. The article explores the possibility for agentsic AI to transform security, and focuses on application to AppSec and AI-powered vulnerability solutions that are automated. The rise of Agentic AI in Cybersecurity Agentic AI refers to self-contained, goal-oriented systems which recognize their environment as well as make choices and then take action to meet the goals they have set for themselves. Contrary to coâ€¦

entry.title: Sky pitches ousting Maker token, enabling staking, to complete upgrade
entry.summary: Decentralized finance (DeFi) lending platform Sky has pitched a proposal to finalize its upgrade from Maker by replacing its governance token and enabling staking. The proposal, posted on May 1 to Skyâ€™s decentralized autonomous organization (DAO) forum, would see the Sky (SKY) token take over the Maker (MKR) token as the protocolâ€™s governance token. If the DAO accepts, the change would be slated to take place around May 15 to May 19 and downgrading from SKY to MKR would also be disabled. Sky co-founder Rune Christensen said in response to the proposal that it was a â€œhuge milestone,â€ which he â€œfully supports,â€ and laments that allowing users to downgrade from SKY back to MKR has been a â€œkey limiting factor preventing exchanges from adopting SKY.â€ â€œWith this change, exchanges are likely to mâ€¦

entry.title: Kraken details how it spotted North Korean hacker in job interview
entry.summary: US crypto exchange Kraken has detailed a North Korean hackerâ€™s attempt to infiltrate the organization by applying for a job interview. â€œWhat started as a routine hiring process for an engineering role quickly turned into an intelligence-gathering operation,â€ the company wrote in a May 1 blog post. Kraken said the applicantâ€™s red flags appeared early on in the process when they joined an interview under a name different from what they applied with and â€œoccasionally switched between voices,â€ apparently being guided through the interview. Rather than immediately rejecting the applicant, Kraken decided to advance them through its hiring process to gather information about the tactics used. International sanctions have effectively cut North Korea off from the rest of the world, and the countryâ€™â€¦

entry.title: Kraken finalizes NinjaTrader buy as Q1 revenue jumps 19%
entry.summary: Crypto exchange Kraken has completed its acquisition of the futures trading platform NinjaTrader and reported its first quarter revenues jumped 19% year-on-year to $471.7 million. Kraken said in a May 1 report that its NinjaTrader acquisition would give its US customers access to the traditional derivatives market, aligning with its plans to expand its offerings and be the go-to platform for all types of trading. NinjaTrader is a registered Futures Commission Merchant with the Commodity Futures Trading Commission. Last month, it rolled out trading for over 11,000 stocks and exchange-traded funds to certain US clients. The deal, which Kraken dubbed the largest ever between a crypto and traditional finance firm, allows NinjaTrader to expand to the UK, continental Europe and Australian marketâ€¦

entry.title: Tether posts $1B in Q1 operating profit, $5.6 billion excess in reserves
entry.summary: Tether, the company behind the worldâ€™s largest stablecoin by market capitalization, has released its financials for the first quarter of 2025, disclosing nearly $120 billion in exposure to US Treasurys and over $1 billion in operating profit. According to Tetherâ€™s Q1 2025 financial report, the companyâ€™s assets include $98.5 billion in direct US Treasury bills, along with over $23 billion in additional exposure through repurchase agreements and other cash-equivalent assets. Excerpt from Tetherâ€™s Q1 2025 financial report. Source: Tether According to the announcement, Tether holds $5.6 billion in excess of reserves for its USDt (USDT) stablecoin, down from $7.1 billion in excess from the last quarter of 2024. The stablecoin has a market capitalization of $149 billion as of May 1. â€œCirculating supply of USDT grew by approximately $7 billion in Q1, with a 46 million increase in user wallets,â€ it said. The company's excess capital continues to fund strategic investments, with more than $2 billion allocated in renewable energy, artificial intelligence, peer-to-peer communications, and data infrastructure.Â The stablecoin market is broadly dominated by tokens pegged to the US dollar, with USDT and Circleâ€™s USDC holding a combined 87% share.Â According to the US Treasuryâ€™s Q1 2025 report, the market cap for dollar-backed stablecoins is poised to reach $2 trillion by 2028. European Union officials have recently raised concerns about the risks of overreliance on dollar-pegged stablecoins. According to the Bank of Italy, disruptions in the stablecoins market or the underlying bonds could have â€œrepercussions for other parts of the global financial system.â€ Magazine: Crypto wanted to overthrow banks, now itâ€™s becoming them in stablecoin fight

entry.summary: Despite reports in February suggesting that 2 million pro-crypto voters could decide the outcome of this weekâ€™s Australian Federal Election, crypto has barely rated a mention during the campaign. â€œI think itâ€™s a missed opportunity,â€ Independent Reserve founder Adrian Przelozny told Cointelegraph. â€œNeither side has made crypto a headline issue because theyâ€™re wary of polarizing voters or sounding too niche.â€ But the good news is that after more than a decade of inaction, both the ruling Australian Labor Party (ALP) and the opposition Liberal Party are promising to enact crypto regulations developed in consultation with the industry. entry.title: Mango Markets exploiter sentenced to over 4 years on child abuse material charges
entry.summary: Avraham Eisenberg was sentenced to more than four years in prison on child sexual abuse material charges, unrelated to his role in the 2022 exploit that drained the decentralized exchange Mango Markets of roughly $100 million. According to reporting from Inner City Press, a judge sentenced Eisenberg to 52 months in prison at a May 1 hearing in the US District Court for the Southern District of New York. The case was filed in April 2024 after Eisenbergâ€™s 2023 indictment on fraud for the Mango Markets exploit. Eisenberg was initially scheduled to be sentenced in July 2024 following his guilty plea on the child porn charge. In May 2024, the judge suggested the sentencing for both cases would occur simultaneously in a consolidated proceeding. However, as of May 1, the fraud sentencing remains â€¦

entry.title: Strategy touts 14% YTD Bitcoin yield in Q1 earnings print, misses estimates
entry.summary: Update (May 1, 11:35 pm UTC): This article has been updated to add Strategyâ€™s revenue, net loss and analyst estimates. Michael Saylor's Bitcoin-buying firm Strategy, formerly MicroStrategy, has reported earning a year-to-date yield of 13.7% on its Bitcoin holdings as it missed Wall Street's first-quarter estimates. The company said in its May 1 earnings statement that its year-to-date Bitcoin (BTC) yield equates to a gain of more than 61,000 BTC, worth approximately $5.8 billion. Bitcoin yield and gain are unofficial accounting metrics Strategy uses to benchmark the success of its BTC buys.Â Strategyâ€™s chief financial officer, Andrew Kang, said it would increase its Bitcoin yield target for this year to 25% and its Bitcoin gain target to $15 billion. It comes as Strategy missed top and botâ€¦

entry.title: Devs introduce Ethereum R1 layer-2 scaling solution
entry.summary: A group of developers within the Ethereum ecosystem, operating independently of the Ethereum Foundation, have announced Ethereum R1 â€” a layer-2 (L2) scaling solution for the Ethereum network that does not include a native token. According to the announcement, the project relies entirely on donations, does not have venture funding, and does not have any pre-mined token allocations or a governance token. The project's team wrote in a May 1 X post: "General-purpose L2s should be commodities â€” simple, replaceable, and free from centralized dependencies or risky governance. Ethereum R1 is our answer to that call â€” the rollup grounded in credible neutrality, decentralization, and censorship resistance." "Most L2s today are acting more like new L1s than an Ethereum scaling solution â€” private alloâ€¦

entry.title: Federal crypto legislation could come with a â€˜New York State of Mindâ€™
entry.summary: Love it or leave it, New York State has been a force in crypto regulation. Ten years ago, the state created the United Statesâ€™ first comprehensive regulatory framework for firms dealing in cryptocurrencies, including key consumer protection, anti-money laundering compliance and cybersecurity guidelines. In September 2015, the New York Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) issued its first BitLicense to Circle Internet Financial, enabling the company to conduct digital currency business activity in the state. Ripple Markets received the second BitLicense in 2016. Circle and Ripple went on to become giant players in the global cryptocurrency and stablecoin industry. Today, the NYDFS regulates one of the largest pools of crypto firms in the world, and it is often cited as the gold standardâ€¦

entry.title: The case for enterprise-grade custody solutions
entry.summary: Opinion by: Vikash Singh, Principal Investor at Stillmark The Bybit hack resulted in the largest loss of funds to cyber hackers by a cryptocurrency exchange in history. It served as a wake-up call for those complacent about the state of security threats in the digital assets space. Everyone must learn the lesson from this heist â€” enterprise-grade custody solutions require tech to be accompanied by transparency. Unlike many previous incidents, this loss of funds was not due to a faulty smart contract, lost/mismanaged keys or deliberate mismanagement or rehypothecation of user funds, but rather a sophisticated social engineering attack that exploited vulnerabilities in operational security.Â This hack differs from earlier eras because it happened to a major global exchange that takes securitâ€¦

entry.title: Bitcoin yield demand booming as institutions seek liquidity â€” Solv CEO
entry.summary: The demand for yield-generating strategies around Bitcoin (BTC) is surging, especially from firms seeking liquidity without liquidating their BTC, according to Ryan Chow, co-founder and CEO of Solv Protocol. During a fireside chat at the Token2049 conference in Dubai on May 1, Chow said institutional interest in Bitcoin yield products has grown exponentially over the past few years. Initially, generating Bitcoin yield was nearly impossible. However, recent innovations like staking via proof-of-stake (PoS) protocols and delta-neutral trading strategies have made this possible. Layer-1 and layer-2 advancements, such as Babylon, have made these strategies more viable. Babylon allows BTC holders to earn yield on their assets, which are used to provide security and liquidity for PoS networks. â€œâ€¦

entry.title: Ethereum to simplify crosschain transactions with new token standards
entry.summary: Ethereum developers are working to improve blockchain interoperability with two new token standards: ERC-7930 and ERC-7828. â€œThereâ€™s no standard way for wallets, apps, or protocols to interpret or display this information,â€ decentralized finance (DeFi) ecosystem development organization Wonderland wrote in a May 1 X post. Wallets, decentralized applications (DApps), block explorers and smart contracts follow different rules. â€œThe result? A messy, inconsistent experience that breaks cross-chain UX,â€œ Wonderland stated. Wonderland is a group of developers, researchers and data scientists focused on improving the Ethereum DeFi ecosystem. The organization partnered with multiple DeFi protocols, including Optimism, Aztec, Connext and Yearn. Wonderlandâ€™s ERC-7828 and ERC-7930 explanation post. Soâ€¦

entry.title: 21Shares files for US spot Sui ETF after European launch
entry.summary: Major European cryptocurrency investment firm 21Shares has filed for a spot Sui exchange-traded fund (ETF) in the United States, marking another step in its expansion to the US market. 21Shares on April 30 submitted the Form S-1 registration for a spot Sui (SUI) ETF to the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC). Called the 21Shares Sui ETF, the proposed ETF will issue common shares of beneficial interest by seeking to track the performance of SUI held by 21Sharesâ€™ US subsidiary. The US filing comes a year after 21Shares started trading the 21Shares Sui Staking exchange-traded product in Europe in July 2024, with its first listings on Euronext Paris and Euronext Amsterdam. No ticker or planned exchange yet The 128-page filing does not specify on which US exchange the new SUI ETF is expâ€¦

entry.summary: Amid the intensifying global race to tokenize real-world assets, the market is still too nascent for institutional adoption, according to Chris Yin, the co-founder and CEO of Galaxy-backed RWA platform Plume. Institutional capital is yet to enter the RWA market, and it will take some time for institutions to see its value, Yin told Cointelegraph on the sidelines of Token2049 in Dubai. â€œThese things move incredibly slowly, you have to show value, you have to show adoption first,â€ Yin said, comparing RWAâ€™s currently developing stages with the early days of Bitcoin (BTC) and stablecoins. â€œOnly now, 10 years later, are they beginning to think about using the stablecoin. The same thing is going to happen in tokenized assets or tokenization,â€ Yin said. Tokenized RWAs are far smaller than $21 bilâ€¦

entry.title: Google subpoena scam: What it looks like and how to avoid it
entry.summary:
What is a Google subpoena scam?
The Google subpoena scam is a type of phishing attack where fraudsters impersonate Google to create a false sense of urgency and fear.Â Typically, you will receive an email that appears to come from no-reply@google.com, claiming to inform you of a subpoena, a formal legal request. The email will often have a subject line like â€œSecurity Alertâ€ or â€œNotice of Subpoena,â€ making it seem urgent and legitimate. These scammers prey on your natural concern about legal matters and data privacy, hoping to trigger a reaction. Inside the email, the scammers falsely claim that Google has been served with a subpoena requiring the company to turn over your account data, such as emails, documents or search history. The email will theâ€¦

entry.summary: Banking giant Morgan Stanley reportedly plans to list cryptocurrencies on its E*Trade investment brokerage and trading platform. The plan is still in early development, and the bank is said to be exploring partnerships with established crypto firms to power the service. Internal discussions about cryptocurrency support reportedly began in late 2024. E*Trade homepage. Source: E*Trade This would not be Morgan Stanleyâ€™s first exposure to digital assets.
